full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement
#### Solicitation Number: 01R11-25-012
#### Solicitation Date: 2024-06-07
#### Closing Date: 2024-07-23
#### Title: Water and Wastewater Audits in Alberta and British Columbia

Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada invites proposals from experienced consulting firms to conduct a comprehensive water and wastewater audit across seven Research and Development Centres in Alberta and British Columbia. The study aims to verify compliance with local, federal, and provincial regulations, and identify opportunities for water conservation. 

**Key Dates:**

* Closing Date: 2024-07-23
* Expected Contract Start Date: Not specified

**Tender Description:**

An experienced consulting firm is required to conduct a wastewater audit, water system survey, and cross-connection control evaluation at seven Research and Development Centres in Alberta and British Columbia. The mandate is to determine if the facilities adhere to local and provincial regulations and guidelines. The project involves a comprehensive inspection and evaluation of the potable water and wastewater systems to identify deficiencies and develop a strategy to address them.

**Security Requirements:**

Contractor/offeror personnel requiring access to secure sites must hold a valid RELIABILITY STATUS, approved by Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada.

**Evaluation Criteria:**

Bids will be evaluated based on technical merit and price. Responsive bidders with the highest combined rating of technical merit and price will be recommended for award.

**Submission Instructions:**

Tenders must be submitted to Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada at [melissa.smith3@agr.gc.ca](mailto:melissa.smith3@agr.gc.ca). Bidders are encouraged to use the Canada Post Corporation's CPC Connect service to transmit their bid electronically.

**Trade Agreements:**

This tender complies with the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, and other bilateral agreements.

**Attachements:**

Refer to the official Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) for bid solicitation attachments and qualifications.

**Note:**

Canada retains the right to negotiate with any supplier and advises that notices and bid solicitations may be posted on the GETS website. Please ensure to consult the GETS website for the most up-to-date information. CCFTA and ALE cannot be counted towards the IPC spend limit.
